alert.note: Alert for Starr (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 10:47PM CDT until May 31 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Starr. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1047 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rio Grande City, Sullivan City, Garciasville, La Rosita, La Grulla, Las Lomas, Fort Ringgold County Park, Ringgold Middle School, Rio Grande City Fire Department, La Puerta, Starr County Sheriffs Office, Santa Cruz, Rio Grande City Municipal Airport, Starr County Memorial Hospital, Los Alvarez, Alto Bonito, La Victoria, Los Garzas, Garceno and Grulla Middle School. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
